title: woylier
text: example illustrates 1D visualization interpolation 3 points 6D.
code: # Generate 1D example  set.seed(2022) p <- 6 base1 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d=1) base2 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d=1) base3 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d=1)  # First example  frames <- givens_full_path(base1, base2, nsteps = 10)  sp <- generate_space_view(p=p)  sp_path <- add_path(sp, frames)   point1 <- as.data.frame(t(base1))  point1$type <- "point1"  point2 <- as.data.frame(t(base2)) point2$type <- "point2"  sp_path <- rbind(sp_path, point1, point2)   # second example  frames <- givens_full_path(base2, base3, nsteps = 10)  frames <- as.data.frame(t(apply(frames, 3, c)))  frames$type <- "path" sp_path <- rbind(sp_path, frames)  point3 <- as.data.frame(t(base3)) point3$type <- "point3"  sp_path <- rbind(sp_path, point3)   tourr::animate_xy(sp_path[,1:p], col=sp_path$type,                    axes="bottomleft") #> Converting input data to the required matrix format. #> Using half_range 0.55

title: woylier
code: # Generate 2D example  set.seed(2022) n <- 1000 p <- 3 d <- 2 base1 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d) base2 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d)  frames_2d <- givens_full_path(base1, base2, 10)  proj_2d <- map(1:n, ~tourr::basis_random(n = p,  d=d)) %>%   purrr::flatten_dbl() %>%    matrix(ncol = p*2, byrow = TRUE) %>%   as_tibble() #> Warning: The `x` argument of `as_tibble.matrix()` must have unique column names if #> `.name_repair` is omitted as of tibble 2.0.0. #> ℹ Using compatibility `.name_repair`.  # Path path_2d <- t(apply(frames_2d, 3, c)) %>%    as.data.frame()  # Join proj_2d <- proj_2d %>%    mutate(type="torus")  path_2d <- path_2d %>%    mutate(type="path")  proj_path <- bind_rows(proj_2d, path_2d)  tourr::animate_xy(proj_path[,1:6],                    col=proj_path$type,                    axes="bottomleft") #> Converting input data to the required matrix format. #> Using half_range 0.73

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {woylier: Alternative tour frame interpolation method},   author = {Zola Batsaikan and Dianne Cook and Ursula Laa},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Alternative tour frame interpolation method
text: “woylier” package provides alternative method generating tour path interpolating d-D frames p-D space rather d-D planes.

title: Alternative tour frame interpolation method
text: can install development version woylier GitHub :

title: Alternative tour frame interpolation method
text: example illustrates 1D visualization interpolation 3 points 6D. {r setup} library(woylier)
code: # Generate 1D example  set.seed(2022) p <- 6 base1 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d=1) base2 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d=1) base3 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d=1)  # First example  frames <- givens_full_path(base1, base2, nsteps = 10)  sp <- generate_space_view(p=p)  sp_path <- add_path(sp, frames)   point1 <- as.data.frame(t(base1))  point1$type <- "point1"  point2 <- as.data.frame(t(base2)) point2$type <- "point2"  sp_path <- rbind(sp_path, point1, point2)   # second example  frames <- givens_full_path(base2, base3, nsteps = 10)  frames <- as.data.frame(t(apply(frames, 3, c)))  frames$type <- "path" sp_path <- rbind(sp_path, frames)  point3 <- as.data.frame(t(base3)) point3$type <- "point3"  sp_path <- rbind(sp_path, point3)   tourr::animate_xy(sp_path[,1:p], col=sp_path$type,                    axes="bottomleft")

title: Overlay paths of interpolation on the sphere — add_path
code: p <- 4 base1 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d=1) base2 <- tourr::basis_random(p, d=1) path <- givens_full_path(base1, base2, nsteps=10) sp <- generate_space_view(p=p) sp_path <- add_path(sp, path)  if (FALSE) {   tourr::animate_xy(sp_path[,1:4], col=sp_path$type) }

text: current starting frame target target frame frozen indicator whether dimensions fixed ...

title: Interpolation format for tourr — givens_path
text: interpolate function single parameter 0, 1 returns interpolated frame current future frames. 0 gives current plane, 1 gives new target frame plane current frame. dist distance, radians, current target frames. Fa current frame. Fz new target frame. tau principle angles current target frames. Ga current plane. Gz target plane.

code: guided_tour_givens(   index_f,   d = 2,   alpha = 0.5,   cooling = 0.99,   max.tries = 25,   max.i = Inf,   search_f = search_geodesic,   n_sample = 100,   ... )

title: Create a guided tour with Givens interpolation — guided_tour_givens
text: index_f index function optimise. d target dimensionality alpha initial size search window, radians cooling amount size search window adjusted step max.tries maximum number unsuccessful attempts find better projection giving max.maximum index value, stop search larger value found search_f search strategy use: search_geodesic, search_better, search_better_random, search_polish. Default search_geodesic. n_sample number samples generate search_f search_polish ... arguments sent search_f

title: Create a guided tour with Givens interpolation — guided_tour_givens

what: woylier: Alternative tour frame interpolation method — woylier-package
title: woylier: Alternative tour frame interpolation method — woylier-package
text: method generates tour path interpolating d-D frames p-D using Givens rotations. algorithm arises problem zero'ing elements matrix. interpolation method useful showing specific d-D frames tour, opposed d-D planes, done geodesic interpolation. useful projection pursuit indexes rotationally invariant. See Buja et al (2005) https://doi.org/10.1016/S0169-7161(04)24014-7.

title: woylier: Alternative tour frame interpolation method — woylier-package
